abstracts.cdata!:
The HIV/AIDS Rapid Response Project of
            The Gambia had the following ratings: outcomes were
            moderately unsatisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            substantial, Bank performance was moderately satisfactory,
            and borrower performance was moderately unsatisfactory. The
            lessons learned included: 1) Establishment of a new
            institution takes time and support for effective operation
            is a must; 2) Multi sector program requires effective
            coordination and communication; 3) Accountability matters;
            4) Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) is essential for a
            learning-by-doing project; and 5) Sustainability plan should
            be incorporated into the interventions.
